message.entry: Sheet number must be a positive finite integer.
Pass ''0'' for LibXL, ''1'' for COM, and ''2'' for Google Sheets. All other inputs are invalid.
The second input must be a character vector specifying the name of an existing file.
Could not create a workbook.
Unable to open file ''{0}'' as a workbook. Check that the file exists, read access is available, and the file is a valid spreadsheet file.
Could not create or initialize Worksheet.
Invalid data type. ''Sheet'' input must be a character vector specifying the sheet name or a positive finite integer specifying the sheet index.
Sheet name ''{0}'' does not exist or is not supported. To check if the sheet is supported, specify the sheet by its worksheet index.
Sheet index {0,number,integer} exceeds the number of sheets in the workbook.
The file name ''{0}'' is incompatible with the format ''{1}''.
Unable to save the workbook to file ''{0}''. Check that write permissions are available, there is sufficient disk space, and the file can be written to or created.
Sheet names must be a string array with the same number of elements as the number of sheets in the workbook.
The sheet named ''{0}'' already exists.
An internal error occurred.
File extension ''{0}'' is not supported on computers without Excel for Windows or when ''UseExcel'' is set to false.
Invalid sheet name. Name must be text and contain 1-31 characters, excluding :, \\, /, ?, *, [, and ].
Invalid sheet name. Name must be text and contain 1-100 characters.
File extension is not supported in this context. Ensure the extension is one of the following: ''XLSX'', ''XLS'', ''XLSM'', ''XLSB'', ''XLTX'', ''XLTM'', or ''ODS''.
File extension is not supported in this context. Ensure the extension is one of the following: ''XLSX'', ''XLS'', ''XLSM'', ''XLTX'', or ''XLTM''.

The ''{0}'' format is not supported in this context. Set the ''UseExcel'' parameter to true on Windows with Excel installed to read and write ''XLSB'' or ''ODS'' files and spreadsheets with interactive features, such as formulas and macros.
Chart sheets are not supported.
Unable to write file.
Using Excel for reading and writing spreadsheet files is only supported on Windows. Switching ''UseExcel'' to false.
Using Excel is not recommended for web apps. Switch ''UseExcel'' to false.
